title: Production secret key leak in config/secrets.yml
content:
Summary:
Production secret key leak in config/secrets.yml
Description:
In Github, http://engineering.grab.com/ secret_key_base is leaked which is present in the config/secrets.yml
Steps To Reproduce:
Go to the below GitHub URL and we can verify that secret_key_base is present.
Code 113 Bytes
1https://github.com/grab/blogs/blob/master/2017-01-29-deep-dive-into-database-timeouts-in-rails/config/secrets.yml
Mitigation:-
Code 89 Bytes
1https://medium.com/@thejasonfile/hide-your-api-keys-hide-your-skype-api-keys-884427746f9c
Impact
Proper Impact is explained here:-
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44220691/rails-what-are-the-consequences-of-a-leaked-secret-key-base
steps: Verify that the `secret_key_base` is present in the file
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves the exposure of the `secret_key_base` in a publicly accessible GitHub repository. This key is critical for securing sessions and other sensitive data in a Rails application. If leaked, it can lead to session hijacking, remote code execution, and other severe security breaches.
reason: The discovery of this vulnerability is straightforward as it only requires accessing a public GitHub repository and checking for the presence of the `secret_key_base` in a configuration file. There are no complex interactions or multiple components involved in the discovery process.
